intro: Campanula dalmatica, commonly known as the Dalmatian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It features attractive blue to violet bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sun, often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Campanula dalmatica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
